metadata.title: CVE-2022-48742 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:rtnetlink: make sure to refresh master_dev/m_ops in __rtnl_newlink() Whilelooking at one unrelated syzbot bug, I found the replay logic in__rtnl_newlink() to potentially trigger use-after-free. It is better toclear master_dev and m_ops inside the loop, in case we have to replay it.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48742` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-176-generic - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-176-generic - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-176-lowlatency - 4.15.0-176.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1127-aws - 4.15.0-1127.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
